author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Three 6 Mafia rapper Koopsta Knicca dies at 36
text:
Johnny Nunez/WireImage Koopsta Knicca in New York City last year. He died at the young age of 36. Koopsta Knicca, a longtime member of the rap group Three 6 Mafia, died Friday at the age of 36 following a stroke.
DJ Paul, a founding member of the Memphis band, announced the sad news on social media, according to TMZ .
"Everyone who knew Koop knew hew was very funny and the coolest guy ever!," DJ Paul wrote Friday, according to the gossip website. "He will be missed!!!"
Koopsta Knicca, also known as Robert Cooper Phillips, had been in the hospital since last weekend after suffering the stroke, TMZ reported. He was on life support due to an aneurysm, Action News 5 in Memphis reported .
DJ Paul had prematurely reported the rapper's death on Thursday, but Koopsta Knicca did succumb from the stroke the next day.
"To all who are concerned Robert Cooper Phillips aka Koopsta Knicca has officially left us all," Phillips' Facebook page read Friday, according to Action 5 News. "This is a great lost to us all. We will continue to keep him alive with his music."
Two years ago Three 6 Mafia co-founder Lord Infamous also passed away, at the age of 40.
DJ Paul and Lord Infamous helped form the band in 1991 under the name "Backyard Posse." Koopsta Knicca joined the same year. He would be known for such songs as "The Mind Of Robert Cooper," "A Murda 'N Room 8" and "Aliens vs Humans."
Koopsta Knicca was not a member of the group when some of its members won an Oscar in 2006 for "It's Hard Out Here for a Pimp," the Best Original Song for the movie "Hustle & Flow."
Koopsta was recently working on a solo album, TMZ reported.
